def _get_grouper(
    obj,
    key=None,
    axis=0,
    level=None,
    sort=True,
    observed=False,
    mutated=False,
    validate=True,
):
    # Logic for handling grouping along columns
    if axis == 1:
        # Check if the key is a valid column name
        if key is not None:
            if is_list_like(key):
                keys = key
            else:
                keys = [key]

            valid_columns = [col for col in obj.columns if col in keys]
            if len(valid_columns) != len(keys):
                raise KeyError("One or more keys are not valid column names")

            # Create the Grouping for columns
            groupings = [
                Grouping(
                    obj.columns,
                    key,
                    obj=obj,
                    name=key,
                    level=level,
                    sort=sort,
                    observed=observed,
                    in_axis=True,
                )
                for key in valid_columns
            ]

            # Create the BaseGrouper for columns
            grouper = BaseGrouper(obj.columns, groupings, sort=sort, mutated=mutated)

            return grouper, [], obj

    # Original logic for handling grouping along index (unchanged)
    group_axis = obj._get_axis(axis)
